summary: I PURCHASED A 2003 FORD ESCAPE A COUPLE OF WEEKS AGO.  I DROVE IT 8 DAYS AND 650 MILES WHEN THE TRANSMISSION WENT OUT.  IT WAS TOWED TO THE DEALER AND HAS BEEN THERE FOR 6 DAYS.  I AM REQUESTING FROM FORD AN EXTENDED WARRANTY ON THE VEHICLE WHICH THEY ARE UNWILLING TO PROVIDE.  THEY ARE FIXING THE DIRECT CLUTCH WHICH FAILED.  I DO NOT THINK AN EXTENDED WARRANTY IS UNREASONABLE.  I KNOW GM WOULD PROVIDE ONE SHOULD THE SITUATION BE THE SAME.   *NLM
